No Poverty.reason: The course discusses trade opportunities for developing countries, which is an inferred mechanism for poverty reduction, but not a central theme.
evidence: The Digital Trade Era – Challenges and Opportunities for Developing Countries

Quality Education.reason: The course is an educational offering that aims to 'develop students’ knowledge' and 'equip students with the knowledge of the emerging information technologies'.
evidence: To enable students with knowledge of cross border digital trade
To equip students with the knowledge of the emerging information technologies in international trade
This course aims to develop students’ knowledge about the digitalization of international trade

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course focuses on international trade as the 'economic backbone of most countries' and aims to increase 'competitive edges in the global business setting'.
evidence: International trade is the economic backbone of most countries in the world.
facilitated the global value chain
To prepare students who wish to enter into global trade businesses

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: The course is fundamentally about the 'digital transformation of international trade' using 'information technologies', 'National Single Window', and 'Blockchain for Trade' to build resilient infrastructure.
evidence: The development of information technologies has pushed forward the trade facilitation and digitalization of cross border exchange.
The digital transformation of international trade has reduced the operation time and costs
Cloud Computing, Big Data Analytics, AI and Blockchain in Digital Trade

Reduced Inequalities.reason: The course addresses reducing trade barriers for 'Developing Countries' and discusses 'Regional Integration', which can help reduce economic inequalities between nations.
evidence: The Digital Trade Era – Challenges and Opportunities for Developing Countries
Non-Tariff Barriers
Regional Integration and Free Trade Agreements

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: The course focuses on building strong institutions for trade through 'policy and regulation issues', 'Legal framework', 'National Single Window', and the 'WTO Trade Facilitation Agreement'.
evidence: policy and regulation issues
Public and Private Partnership (PPP) for Trade Facilitation
WTO Trade Facilitation Agreement
Legal framework

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: The course is centered on multi-stakeholder partnerships, explicitly covering 'Public and Private Partnership (PPP)', 'Regional Integration', 'Global Initiatives', and specific alliances like the 'Pan-Asian E-Commerce Alliance'.
evidence: Public and Private Partnership (PPP) for Trade Facilitation
